_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Program Overview:

At US Amines, we are dedicated to being an industry leader in protecting the environment, the health, and safety of both our employees and the communities in which we operate.  Like our community neighbors, the people who work at the Portsmouth site want a clean, safe environment, with no illnesses or injuries at work, home, or play.  That is why US Amines has a "zero incident" goal.  

Our Facility:

We manufacture several different chemicals in the family of amines.  Our products are used to produce agricultural chemicals, engineering resins, and drugs.  We have about 14 site employees and 10 resident contractors.  US Amines uses a variety of raw materials including anhydrous ammonia and ethylamine to produce several amines including allylamine within its Amines Plant operations at the Portsmouth, Virginia site.  

Plant Safety Activities:

The site has a plant manager who oversees all plant activities.  The staff includes a production manager, maintenance manager, training coordinator, technical support, a part-time nurse who oversees the plant medical program.  All plant employees must attend at least one safety meeting per month.  Safety meetings include training on regulatory requirements and plant specific issues.  Testing is conducted in safety meetings to insure the information is understood.

Plant operators are members of the emergency response team.  They are trained in the specifics of incident command, emergency response, and medical response.  The plant conducts weekly tests of the plant alarm system and conducts emergency response drills with the local fire department.

The US Amines Portsmouth Plant participates in a local community advisory panel and works with other area industrial facilities to promote safety in our operations.  This continued partnership ensures that the community where we all live and work will be a safe place now and in the future.

The US Amines Portsmouth plant complies with RMP and OSHA 1910.119, (the OSH

A Process Safety Regulation) through our Process Safety Management Program.  The Portsmouth plant manages all plant processes per our Process Safety Management program.  The program meets all of the RMP and OSHA requirements such as:
Develop and implement a risk management system.
Conduct hazard assessments of all processes.
Implement accident prevention requirements.
Develop an emergency response program that is coordinated with local agencies.
Track and analyze incidents to prevent reoccurrence.

Five-Year RMP Accident History:

There were no accidents to report.
